TPP2110C - Acting I \u2013 Freeing the A.name: TPP2110C - Acting I – Freeing the Actor

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Theatre major or minor.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of actor's instrument through use of imagination, self-awareness, and integration of voice and movement.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BFA Acting major

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Foundations of improvisation and related vocal, physical, and acting techniques.

TPP2170C - Acting II - The Actor and Tex.name: TPP2170C - Acting II - The Actor and Text

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
B.F.A Acting or Musical Theatre major
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
TPP2110C - Acting I – Freeing the Actor  (3)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fundamental techniques with emphasis on scene study and text analysis focused on the creation of tactics, intentions, and objectives.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to the fundamentals of acting.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Theatre Major, Theatre Minor or Dance Minor

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Participation in UCF Theatre productions.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BA Theatre major or minor. Practical stage voice as it applies to performance.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Credit cannot be applied towards BFA acting and musical theatre majors.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BFA Acting major

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Bringing the actor into an awareness of habitual tensions to release the breath and voice and discover vocal support.

TPP2742C - Estill for Musical Theatre \u.name: TPP2742C - Estill for Musical Theatre – Craft

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Musical Theatre Major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Estill Model of anatomy and physiology of the voice, diction at a distance, and compulsory figures.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: B.A. Theatre Studies major, or BFA Stage Management major or Theatre minor and "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 2110C    or TPP 2185.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Practice and execution of scene work, monologue work, and exercises.

TPP3173C - Acting III - The Actor and Ch.name: TPP3173C - Acting III - The Actor and Character

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
TPP2170C - Acting II - The Actor and Text (3)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Reinforcement of acting techniques begun in Acting II, with emphasis on characterization and character development.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Audition/Interview or departmental consent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Production assignments and responsibilities during the rehearsals/performances of play scripts produced on the UCF mainstage.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Theatre major or minor, Sophomore standing, and THE 2000 and TPP 2110C or TPP 2185.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: In-depth study and application of a specific topic related to theatre performance.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: B.F.A. Musical Theatre major, and "C" (2.0) or better required in TPP 2170C   .

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Practical acting techniques with solo musical theatre repertoire.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: B.F.A. Musical Theatre major, and "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 2170C   .

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Practical acting technique for musical theatre scene study

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: B.F.A. Acting or B.A. Theatre Studies.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Techniques for singing musical theatre repertoire

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: B.F.A. Acting or B.A. Theatre Studies major, and "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 3257C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Singing a variety musical theatre repertoire styles.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BA Theatre major; "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 2110C, and TPP 3103.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Preparing the actor for professional work in the TV/Film industry.

TPP3272C - Estill for Musical Theatre \u.name: TPP3272C - Estill for Musical Theatre – Artistry

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete the following: 
TPP2742C - Estill for Musical Theatre – Craft (2)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Technical, emotional and psychological aspects of voice applied to musical theatre singing. Music and Lyrics as script.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Theatre major and "C" (2.0) or better required in THE 3312.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Principles and techniques of play direction to include script selection, directorial analysis, casting, composition/picturization, blocking, tempo, and rehearsal planning.

TPP3510C - Movement for the Actor I.name: TPP3510C - Movement for the Actor I

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BFA Acting Major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Physical exploration of relaxation, release, and strengthening exercises designed to help the actor develop a more expressive body.

TPP3513C - Movement for the Actor II.name: TPP3513C - Movement for the Actor II

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in TPP 3510C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Reinforcement of the techniques of TPP 3510C.

TPP3711C - Voice and International Phone.name: TPP3711C - Voice and International Phonetic Alphabet

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
TPP2710C - Freeing the Voice (2)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Exploring habits and physical awareness of the vocal tract and the international phonetic alphabet to increase dexterity in speech.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
TPP3711C - Voice and International Phonetic Alphabet  (2)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Engaging the vocal instrument for exploration of heightened text with focus on Shakespeare.

TPP3743C - Musical Theatre Applied/Studi.name: TPP3743C - Musical Theatre Applied/Studio Voice I

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in TPP 3272C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of Musical Theatre voice training with individualized instruction.

TPP3744C - Musical Theatre Applied/Studi.name: TPP3744C - Musical Theatre Applied/Studio Voice II

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in TPP 3743C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of Musical Theatre voice training with individualized instruction.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Audition/Interview or departmental consent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Participation in UCF Theatre productions.

TPP4140C - Acting IV - The Actor at Play.name: TPP4140C - Acting IV - The Actor at Play

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
TPP3173C - Acting III - The Actor and Character (3)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Develop and collaboratively explore broad vocabulary of theatrical skills (possibilities include physical theatre, mask work, devising, playback). Various approaches to applied theatre will be considered.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better required in TPP 3712C    and TPP 4140C .

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Verse drama with particular emphasis placed on scansion and verse in the plays of William Shakespeare.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in TPP 3103 or TPP 4140C   .

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An advanced and comprehensive view of acting styles.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Theatre major or minor

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Participation in UCF Theatre productions.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in TPP 2170C

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Selecting monologues, auditioning techniques and cold readings.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: B.F.A. Acting or Musical Theatre major, Junior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Techniques needed to secure employment in performance or related fields.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Theatre major or minor; "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 2110C    or TPP 2185.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Circus history and introduction to a wide range of circus skills.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Theatre major or minor; "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 2185, or TPP 2110C, and THE 2000.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Application of theatrical storytelling as an art form.

TPP4244H - Honors The Art of Storytellin.name: TPP4244H - Honors The Art of Storytelling

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ENC 1102 and Consent of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Application of theatrical storytelling as an art form. With Honors content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in TPP 3744C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of Musical Theatre voice training. Individualized instruction

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: C (2.0) or better in TPP 4140C

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Application of previous acting training to the TV/Film medium.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 4259C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of Musical Theatre voice training. Individualized instruction

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 4270C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of Musical Theatre voice training. Individualized instruction.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: "B" (3.0) or better grade in TPP 3310C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Practical experience directing class scenes and projects.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
TPP3711C - Voice and International Phonetic Alphabet  (2)
Or
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
TPP3744C - Musical Theatre Applied/Studio Voice II (2)
and Senior standing

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Stage combat with emphasis on hand-to-hand combat.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in TPP 3173C   .

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of Movement/Dance work. Emphasis given to period styles.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Earn a minimum grade of C in each of the following: 
TPP3712C - Voice and Heightened Text  (2)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Synthesizing the voice and speech work into the whole vocal performer with exploration of accents and character voices.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BFA Acting major, "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 4730C

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Specific techniques and demands of voice acting markets.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Theatre major and grade of "C" (2.0) or better in DAA 2201C and TPP 3257C or TPP 2742C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Preparation for professional musical theatre auditions.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: "C" (2.0) or better in TPP 4271C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of Musical Theatre voice training. Individualized instruction.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Restricted to B.F.A. Theatre majors, and Junior Standing and subject to Departmental approval.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Off-campus internship programs in professional theatre. Required of all B.F.A. theatre majors.
